text: The COVID-19 pandemic was confirmed to have reached São Tomé and Príncipe on 6 April 2020. The first death was recorded on 30 April. On 6 April, the first four cases in the country were confirmed. On 30 April, the first death was reported. At that time, São Tomé and Príncipe had 16 cases, 4 of which had recovered, and 1 death. The deceased was a 55-year-old man living in Cantalago. In order to prevent the spread of the virus, the government put in many travel restrictions and quarantining measures. ==References== Category:São Tomé and Príncipe Sao Tome and Principe
title: COVID-19 pandemic in São Tomé and Príncipe
